title: IFS Infor Federated Services
cardDescription: This challenge is to manually maintain Cloud Identity user accounts and security roles
cardSubDescription: x% of community members have completed this challenge
challengeDescription: This challenge is to manually add a Cloud Identity Users and then, using the export-import option, create and modify security roles and user assignments along the way. This process can be used to manage users before a SCIM (System for Cross-domain Identity Management) or the recommended best practices setup is performed.
requirements: IFS Admin Roles: IFSApplicationAdmin, Infor-SystemAdministrator, PortalContentAdministrator, UserAdmin
footer1: X% of people in the community have completed this challenge
footer2: You have earned this badge already! You can attempt againâ€¦

steps.steps: 1.Click the + button to manually add a new cloud identity user. Fill in the First Name, Last Name, User Name & Email Address fields, and unselect the Send Invitation option. Note: This option is used if you are sending an email invitation for a user to complete their setup.
2. In the search field, input the username you just created, click Enter, and then click on User details.
3. Click on the Security Roles tab and click the + Button. Search for and assign the new user these two security roles.

5. Using the export/import option, create a new user from the previously manually created User. Go back to the Users' main page and select the newly manually created user (Note: You may have to search for the user). Then click the export button.
6. Select CSV format and click Export.
